intro: Galium maritimum var. luteiflorum, commonly known as the yellow-flowered bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to maritime climates with salt spray.
